651EGq1LJ17HG_BbG15EFw.text: Great options for carnivores and veggies alike. LOVE the espresso bar. TJ makes the perfect latte. Options like oat milk etc. Food is pricey. Overall great find in great area.

fdXP4OOxOB8L7KCc230Y-Q.text: I have been during the week and weekend at this point. I am always greeted as soon as I walk in. The staff is attentive, full of smiles and personable. I love "Move That Dough"s plant based donuts offered on the weekend. Looking forward to trying all of their weekday specials in the VERY near future.

WR7r59gTZYY9GvgBQxt24g.text: Options for all. Vegetarian or meat lover!! Well married ingredients that you would have never thought to put together.

lUsMH3WaZJN8ix3I4Z_Yzw.text: For my first visit here, it was right after they opened. My boo and I came early afternoon for lunch and a beer. What's nice though is that they serve breakfast ALL DAY! So I ordered an egg and veggie wrap with potatoes and some sort of cream sauce. I liked it a lot, but after sitting down at the bar and getting to know the bartender, she informed us that some menu changes were coming down the line and that would not be on it.. boo. That being said, the beer selection was great and the bartender was fun to talk to without being annoying either. Everyone here is really kind.   Upon the second visit, the same bartender actually remembered us! We continued the convo and trying even more beer options and I also ordered another menu item. Wasn't as impressed, but it won't stop me from going back again.  The atmosphere here is really chill. Music varies, but it's all fun and easy to listen to while you eat/read/work. It's one of those places you can come to hang or just for a quick bite. Outside they have a fireplace which is superrr toasty on a cold day. :)

LbPuh_z81TdHbYJLJxy-yg.text: I agree with the overall 3.5 rating but I'm rounding up to a four because the atmosphere is nice.  When you walk in, it's confusing.  There are multiple order here signs. To order food, you walk all the way to the back.   The order coffee you go to the first bar section.  If you want to order a sandwich and get tap water, you order in the back and then wait in line at the coffee section to get water.  I think they should have self serving water out like Amelie's to solve this problem.   There is a huge variety of drinks both alcoholic and non alcoholic.  I love the way everything is displayed it's very trendy.    I ordered the blt sub cheese for tomato (I'm slightly obsessed with cheese) and my husband got the chicken salad.  Our food came out super fast.  My sandwich was wrong, but they were quick to fix it so I thought that was really good customer service.  The sandwiches were good but nothing special or unique.  We ordered chips as a side.    I would like to go back for breakfast because it looked like that is what most people were ordering.    This is a cute place to bring out of town guests.

photos.caption: Photo of The People's Market at Dilworth - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The People's Market at Dilworth - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The People's Market at Dilworth - Charlotte, NC, United States

FFc1iuwEF9ennkHig2pJgg.text: Stopped by this morning to grab some coffee and breakfast. We just moved to Dilworth so I'm really happy we have our own little market for quick bites, beer/wine, and coffee.   I ordered the sandwich first. Bacon, egg and cheese biscuit. I actually ordered it for my husband, but I took a small bite it was really tasty. My only qualm is that they use American cheese... lord knows why? Can that really even be considered cheese? I wish it was an aged cheddar or something else really.. anything other than American cheese. The sandwich was $5 and it was large too... so the size and price worked for me!  I was surprised at how quick the sandwich came out. That was pretty awesome.   I then went and ordered a cup of coffee. It was a little over $2 for a local roast. This seemed reasonable to me especially because it was a local roast.   Very cool spot. I was rushed (due to said move), but I look forward to stopping back there again!

photos.caption: Photo of The People's Market at Dilworth - Charlotte, NC, United States

LbOht_8_uIrvvI8f6daCtw.text: The People's Market is such a cool place! Such a variety of things to go for. They have a great selection of wine and craft beer from local breweries, as well as a coffee bar by day and bar at night!   The breakfast selection is great! We had breakfast sandwiches when we first went, but could easily order one of everything! The inside is chill too, some outdoor seating available too. Parking can be tough but it's worth it!  There is also a great lunch menu!! I would highly recommend this place for any part of the day or even to just sit back and relax!

photos.caption: Photo of The People's Market at Dilworth - Charlotte, NC, United States

nkpK2ln8Ibn8Bc5H3LM88g.text: This place is interesting. Came in to try their deli with my colleague for lunch. We checked out the menu online and were intrigued by the all-day breakfast.  I had the avocado toast, which is made off wheat toast, guacamole, tomato, red onion, over easy egg, cilantro and added the country ham as protein. It's a $2 upcharge, but I wanted to off-set the sweet guacamole with salty ham.  It was delicious. It fails to say that it is an open-faced sandwich. So make sure you take some utensils with you or things can get messy.  Also added the soup of the day, which was a mushroom and leek chowder. The soup was good, creamy, like you want a chowder to be. And got zappops chips (made in NOLA)...get the Voodoo ones! Any of the 2...love love love  My coworker had the chicken salad sandwich which is made of chicken salad, glazed pecans and red grapes with lettuce, tomato on a brioche bun. She swears by that brioche bun - her guilty pleasure. She also added a soup of the day (they had 2 plus the daily chili). She had the mexican beans soup. Which she loved as well.  Overall the menu was great. I was split between the avocado toast and the morning rancheros. Definitely will try that next time.  They still have a lot of kinks to work out. The layout of the "Market" is all over the place. It's very sparse and you have to go from "station to station". I'm from new york, so i'm used for things to be more crammed and within arms reach. I think it was more the flow of the space. The cashier did note that she wasn't sure where the home made cookies ought to be. They were at the "market register" and I'd suggest them to be by the coffee bar, as you would want something sweet most likely with you brew.  Also odd was that after ordering / getting our food from the deli (all the way in the back) we had to get water at the bar (all the way in the front). With our hands full with our food, we had to walk a lot before getting seated. I wonder if they can serve water from the deli directly. I can understand going to the bar for coffee or beer. They do have soft drinks available in the fridges next to the deli.  They have unique edible goods to purchase, artisan beers, local and international (I'm German, so I appreciated the made-in-germany hefeweizen in a bottle, just like home!) The feature local brews on tap and bottle / cans as well as two-scoop creamery ice cream (YAY! - get the cookies by the sea!)  Lots of space for sitting and chillin, do some work, lots of outlets. there were a few people meeting, for what i guess work. I didn't check the wifi, but it must be good with the amount of people that were there.  Definitely going back to try more of their menu and hopefully they will figure out a better flow of the space in the meantime. Perhaps update my review on their improvements. They just opened and I hope they are there to stay, because the food and the concept are great.

photos.caption: Photo of The People's Market at Dilworth - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bar, and hang-out area. Lots of outlets!!
Photo of The People's Market at Dilworth - Charlotte, NC, United States. Games if you want to hang out
Photo of The People's Market at Dilworth - Charlotte, NC, United States. German beer in a bottle

k6McaJ9mVeC60_kE1ayZLQ.text: I love people's market. They have my favorite breakfast burrito in Charlotte. I love that there's an option to sub veggie sausage. So delicious.  My husband and I come and there are always places to sit and the personality of all the staff members are great. Can't say I've had a bad experience there.

avmgNKXaccSLBuMk6-PosA.text: A great place to catch a drink. We stopped in on a random Saturday afternoon and had a couple drinks over a conversation. The staff was friendly and attentive. They have a great variety of beverages inside and the place is clean. It was a very welcoming environment and our drinks were delicious.   I had a beer named "Bootycall" and my wife had some sort of blueberry cider. They were both great. Next time we'll try some of the food options.   Speaking of options. Aaron Rodgers did all that complaining in the off season and ended up getting a new contract that makes him the higest paid QB in the NFL. But he ain't making NBA money. I mean good for him, he will be able to finally shop at the same stores as Mike Conley.   I guess. But with the wear and tear on the human body that comes from NFL football is it worth it? Who wants to risk CTE for the same money that the 16th best point guard in the NBA makes?   Aaron Rodgers I guess. What a world. I bet when NBA players see him out at the club they call him "Broke boy."   "Ah there he go... old broke @ss Aaron Rodgers. Someone better pick up his tab for him. He probably want to split the check with his broke self!"   Ain't that a trip?

SecjBm2wIaXN1pXGUbo2aA.text: The food was fantastic! I had the chicken biscuit and my husband had the chicken and waffle. The chicken was nice and crispy but juicy on the inside. It is placed on a warm, moist, fluffy biscuit with an egg and sausage gravy on top. A nice hearty meal. My husband enjoyed his food as well. I tasted his waffle. It was warm and fluffy with a kiss of sweet. It comes with a honey cream sauce of which he thoroughly enjoyed.   The vanilla dirty chai (half coffee/ half chai tea) was the best I have ever had! It came in a cute mug with a crafty foam design on top.   Those guys behind the counter definitely know what they are doing!  The place is clean and the people are friendly.  Needless to say, we will definitely be back.

MQjXph04V1WyftFepBTH5Q.text: Oh I love this place! I could spend all of my monies here and all of my time. Breakfast, lunch and dinner. Coffee, beer and wine. All the things you need! Their food is delicious and they carry pastries and those famous vegan donuts. The coffee is really good and the staff are friendly and helpful with making recommendations.  The space is huge and there's plenty of seating around the place. It's a very open concept but set up in a way that it feels like there's different areas. I ordered just a hot coffee and an amazing breakfast sammy and took some baked goods to go for later. Parking is a little crazy since it's on the corner of East Blvd and Kenilworth, but I'll definitely be back.

MLlf9oK2Jn6fm5XMN0mbKg.text: We love the concept and every employee we interacted with was awesome. The menu looked promising and we decided on a chicken biscuit, soda and water. The water bottle was small and $2, which seemed crazy to me. Other stuff was more pricey than I'd expected but I'm willing to pay extra to support local businesses. Aquafina, however, is not a local business so I wasn't feeling that price.   We sat down after ordering our food and were surprised at how quickly our name was called. When we tastes our food, we realized why - our sandwich was luke warm, at best. I went up to the counter for hot sauce (because I believe Texas Pete makes everything better) and noticed an employee bringing a bowl of cooked chicken from the back and setting it on a warmer in the front of the kitchen. I realize this is probably why our chicken wasn't hot - it had been sitting there, premade before we ordered. I would've rather had a few minutes longer of a wait and had hot food that was cooked to order. The taste was okay but not stellar and the biscuit fell apart. When we were finished, the bottom of the container looked like we had literally crumbled up the entire biscuit into small pieces. I think this biscuit could be great if it were executed better.   We will be back to buy local products but will probably wait awhile to revisit the deli again.

photos.caption: Photo of The People's Market at Dilworth - Charlotte, NC, United States. Modified chicken biscuit and water

bxSpSJODKYDuCA2of2AugA.text: Breakfast here hits the spot. Haven't been for lunch or later but look forward to trying it then too. I've been twice to get breakfast to go. I get there just after 7 am and both times I've had the bacon egg and cheese on a big old soft but toasty English muffin. This thing is all fresh cooked with melty cheese and is a hearty portion. No tiny Thomas' English muffin either.

Y9GwrpRF5ifjXQUMc21VOg.text: I'm so happy The People's Market opened up. We need more places that emphasize community and TPM really does that. First off, it's HUGE. There is so much room. Lots of different seating options. I like that the coffee and food are separate, so some people can sit at the bar and others can order food and sit down. There are retail items for purchase all around - an extensive beer collection, wine, snacks, ice cream - you name it. At the bar, they have coffee (including nitro cold brew, my fave!) and beer and possibly kombucha on tap. Plenty of vegan milk options.   Then you head to the back where you can order food. You can pick up a pre-prepared meal or order something hot. They have a variety of options - nothing wildly healthy or super inventive but all very solid. My one big gripe is everything is served in to-go containers: why? Doesn't make sense to me.   Whether you're looking to catch up with friends over a sandwich or sit for a while on your computer with a coffee, TPM has a spot for you!   Oh, and there's a little patio outside too!

IsZYQHFQVcMRPG3rIGuAGg.text: Just looking for a place to have a breakfast sandwich and this place popped up with pretty good reviews so I hopped into dreadful traffic for a 45 min 12 mile drive. Upon arriving we were pleased to see they have their own covered parking garage which is free! The place is very nice with plenty of indoor and outdoor seating. You can place your order at the bar or the kitchen.   The staff was very friendly and started us off with two amazing Lavender Vanilla Iced Coffees  but it didn't end there. I ordered the Chicken Biscuit thinking what the hell you can't go wrong and if you've had one chicken biscuit you've had them all. Well I was very wrong! This was easily the best chicken biscuit I've ever had! The biscuit was so soft and fluffy and the souther Fried Chicken was crispy and very flavorful accompanied by some delicious sausage gravy and scrambled eggs.    Hands down the best I've had! I'm definitely coming back and I recommend you give them a try, you won't be disappointed.

xmaePgGbHawnxOrTzZG1CQ.text: The ease of The People's Market is amazing. Easy parking, easy location, you can easily order online. The environment is crisp, clean, and roomy. There is a covered outdoor patio with picnic table like seating. There are some great local products and beverages available. However, my dropping of stars is for the vegan food.   It's tough to be a vegan in an omnivore world, so when restaurants have a whole separate section for vegan choices it gets exciting- as lame as it sounds.   The upsetting part about this review is both times I have purchased the food, for me it is just subpar. Most recently I had the Latta Good Stuff. I ordered it online and said to add avocado, which they did not. Additionally the bread was supposed to be toasted and it wasn't, resulting in a crumbling mess. Finally, the amount of ingredients to bread ratio is extremely off. The humus was a minimal amount of spread, definitely not enough to even cover the bread and get the flavor . There was one piece of tomato, one piece of lettuce, etc. just not enough to give me flavor. I tasted more bread than anything. If they just bulk up the ingredients and make it worth it, I'll be so happy to support this nice market. But I need to enjoy my food!   I'll keep trying, but please improve the vegan dishes.

h5XB-Lgh9ticQK2Gz_l_bQ.text: I really love this concept for a do-it-all market! They have wine by the bottle, beer by the can, and draft beers on top of it all. They've got pre-packaged foods, snacks, and a full kitchen putting out sandwiches, salads, and breakfast foods (all day!).  We happened to show up on $3.50 pint night, which was fantastic. It's so refreshing to go out for drinks in a trendy neighborhood and only spend $7 (plus tip). They have a decent selection of local and national craft beer, but don't go expecting 20 taps of every style imaginable. They also do not have a full bar, if you're looking for that.  I really enjoyed their Superfood Salad. I firmly believe that salads should have as many ingredients as possible, and People's Market delivered. From avocado to craisins to soba noodles, this salad packed a punch! The cool salad and cold beer were the perfect antidote on an (extremely) humid night after an (extremely) hot yoga class.  Shoutout to the Carolina Honey Sriracha chips - they are delicious! I've never seen them anywhere else before and was pleased to find a regional good on the shelves of People's Market.  Will definitely visit again when I'm back in the neighborhood.

02_hT7fiLwvzCeYUFXbdyA.text: I'm so happy The People's Market is finally Open! I went here a few times since it's in a convenient location. First, they have a solid food menu. The breakfast options are AWESOME and the coffee is delicious. I opted for the breakfast burrito, which was filled with egg, potatoes, cheese and a great herb aoli. I was stuffed afterwords...just like the burrito. I highly recommend for breakfast!  Lunch also had a great selection. I had a turkey sandwich with tomato and sriracha mayo (not spicy but had good flavor). I saw they have salads but didn't try any. If you don't like what they offer, you can build your own.   One of the best parts about The People's Market is the array of local foods stocked on the shelves. Love the local support! Aside from the shelves, they have a bar with a bunch of local beers on tap.  Overall, a great, clean, modern space to gather with friends to come by yourself and have a beverage and something to eat. Fair warning, they food takes a little while to come out, so don't swing by if you're in a massive rush. I'm sure I will be here multiple times a week and will be cleaning them out of pimento cheese and beer.

photos.caption: Photo of The People's Market at Dilworth - Charlotte, NC, United States. And this is awesome

Of9hgSXskgMybQAQpNxreg.text: Noticed this place while walking to Starbucks across the street and thought I would check it out. As others mentioned, you order at the counter all the way in the back, plus you pick out your drink and snack first.  I ordered the BLT and had plantain chips with cinnamon to accompany. The BLT was good, loads of fresh avocado on it, and the bacon was nice and crispy, just the way I like it. Interior was spacious with a warehouse feel. They have a bar inside, plus loads of wine and beer to purchase.

yo0CTjyrAy9lw1fSycXvTg.text: Really cool spot with a small market, restaurant, and bar. Lots of seating and enough nooks and crannies to either do work or chat with friends. I had the salmon quinoa salad for an early dinner. It was pretty good and the salmon portion was generous. The staff is really great as well.

CUyecYlbNzA_noNnnmXnlQ.text: The people's market in Dilworth is a trendy neighborhood spot that serves breakfast, tea, wine and . They serve sandwiches it can be busy during peak hours. I like how convenient the location is everything is within walking distance. I recommend ordering the chicken biscuit with gravy!

86GGu0dKBeLuAax0mvdtQw.text: Good fast customer service! And the Impossible vegan burger was amazing, fellow vegans you must try!

N0t1pTTOVrsxud-SsZo2sA.text: Great place to work, study, have meetings. When busy, it can get noisy. Not the place you want to work if you need quiet time but overall a great selection of food and drinks.

9ILOU3lKWER-w_eYvXa3Hg.text: Stumbled upon this gem visiting The Queen and Glass for the first time on a Friday night . We decide to come back Saturday for brunch . I thoroughly enjoyed my chicken and waffles with cheese eggs. Although my eggs initially came plain the staff immediately corrected it and brought me out some Fresh eggs with cheese. The chicken was season so well, I couldn't get enough of it !! I also enjoyed watching the freshly squeezed mimosa being made . We all tried the Rum Mosa and it was not only delicious but it made me feel good after just one glass The bartenders were attentive especially the guys. I am now adding The People's Market to my to go brunch spots . I can not wait to try the other items on the menu. Also, there was a nice beer selection and a bargain beer basket with beers for 2.99.

photos.caption: Photo of The People's Market at Dilworth - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The People's Market at Dilworth - Charlotte, NC, United States

lZ-_NYi4zh_YNcf46RkTfw.text: This corner market/deli is perfect for hanging out   for lunch and/or working on a laptop. I came here solo to grab a quick sandwich a few weeks ago and had a good experience. Quick in and out, the deli (where you order food) is loacated at the back of the market. I parked on the street, I thought I was lucky to find a spot, but later found out there is a garage below the market that has ample parking!   I came in again today with a group of co-workers to work on a presentation for work. We were able to snag a larger table for the 6 of us and everyone enjoyed their meals! The deli can be a little pricey and each item is a la carte, so it adds up if you want a lot of side items. The avocado chicken sandwich has been my go-to both times and I have yet to be disappointed! The group I was with was happy about the parking garage, the table was big enough for all our laptops and papers, the noise level wasn't too high, and the food was good!   Definately recommend for a working lunch if you are in the area! Maybe next time I will venture out of my avocado chicken sandwich!

photos.caption: Photo of The People's Market at Dilworth - Charlotte, NC, United States. Larger tables next to the bar area
Photo of The People's Market at Dilworth - Charlotte, NC, United States. Blackened Chicken Avocado sandwich was the bomb!

07uIlUAueMFahz0fEUB2CQ.text: Very cute, very clean , spot in Dilworth. They have a little bit of everything going on like most markets in town .   Gifts, beer on tab, full coffee menu with local coffee available, moderate size snack collection with the popular health conscious items , beer can fridge and shelves of wine bottles , deli that serves breakfast all day and a good amount of table and bar seating .   They've got drink specials and food specials. I tried and recommend the fried chicken ( breast) and waffle. There is a neat little cream they give you that come solid, but melts perfectly on you waffle or chicken and is really unique, sweet and tasty.

photos.caption: Photo of The People's Market at Dilworth - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken &amp; Waffle

MziKf5BIf9vT15OIqwtcxg.text: Great brunch area with a really chilled vibe. I had their breakfast platter and the food was cooked well and was tasty. The bartender was very friendly and was able to explain their drink selections (as there was some I haven't heard of). There are extra food selections to choose from around the restaurant such as baked chips, drinks, ice cream, etc. I highly recommend this place to any newcomer looking for a good brunch or lunch place.

photos.caption: Photo of The People's Market at Dilworth - Charlotte, NC, United States. Amateur photographer display.

mE1FWHLB5zHQU5aqBJiHNg.text: After moving to closer to Dilworth I've passed this place on numerous occasions and never actually stopped by and just made a mental note to visit later.  I met a friend for a business meeting and we decided to meet here. Charlotte has plenty of "markets", each with it's on clientele and niche. I enjoyed the modern take here. We have enough divey, bodega like places but this is truly a great take on the concept. You walk in and can pick whether to shop for goods, grab a bite to eat or order from the full bar. The drinks are reasonably priced and the food is great! The portions are just right. I typically order the chicken and waffles. Two boneless chicken breasts and a nice sized waffle priced at $9! There's plenty of natural lighting, an outdoor patio and indoor seating, The bar is massive and a great focal point here.   Some big pluses here:   1) There's free parking inside the garage for the venues including The People's Market 2)   My only gripe here is the space's size hinders the food pickup process. Once you place your order, it isn't as natural to go pick up something to drink or order from the bar since the bar and seating is so far from the kitchen. It isn't uncommon to miss your name being called. I know there isn't anything that they can do in this situation, it just takes away from the fluidity here.   I'd still recommend this place to anyone as TJ, the guy with locs, makes you feel right at home. The rest of the staff is friendly and willing to help in anyway possible as well.   Two thumbs up over here!

-ZW8zT3LqpWM-Z1WKQMFcg.text: The food was really good. I was drawn to the restaurant after seeing photos of their chicken biscuit. It was so crispy and flavorful. The biscuit alone was filling but I also had a side of hash browns to top it off. I'll be back the atmosphere on a Sunday morning was calm and relaxing.  I would definitely recommend and plan to go back again!

photos.caption: Photo of The People's Market at Dilworth - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken biscuit no gravy

H7jz2o2V4QsOYHCPerYcMw.text: Such a cool space! Great options for sandwiches + coffee + beer + wine + gourmet gifts.   This would be a great place to come do work - not too loud and plenty of tables inside and out.   I had the Salmon BLT without bacon and it was delicious! The bread was perfect and the salmon wasn't fishy at all. Loved the addition of sprouts.   The sides are al a carte - I tried the cucumber salad and pasta salad. The cucumber salad was light and refreshing and likely vegan. The pasta salad was tasty but noting to write home about.   My husband got the Vegan Burger - Beyond Meat patty w arugula, Dijon and grilled mushrooms and onions - very tasty!    Your order your food at the deli in the back and start a tab. Then go to the bar to order coffee or wine/beer. Then they'll call your name to pick up your food at the back deli.   Love that you can buy beer to take home and make your own 6 pack!

photos.caption: Photo of The People's Market at Dilworth - Charlotte, NC, United States. Part of the retail beer options
Photo of The People's Market at Dilworth - Charlotte, NC, United States. Salmon BLT
Photo of The People's Market at Dilworth - Charlotte, NC, United States

aY3VeBnj7Shn68vVeYKJIg.text: Cool place to grab a drink and a snack. They have an assortment of things. Found the coffee to be bitter but found some cool beer singles in their cooler to take home and try out.

EYywSrH8E0-9KEpc82GuSQ.text: On the corner of East Blvd and Scott, former location of 305 East Restaurant.   Cool little spot they redone and turned into a market with a coffee shop, beer shop, food, randomly goodies and specialities.   Good location, nice place to sit for a drink or bite. With friends, alone, work, study, etc.   I tried the coffee spot! Lady working was super friendly and chill. I ordered a Lavender Vanilla Latte! Came out quick. Was yummy! Nice hint of lavender, nothing too crazy! $5.14 with tax, price as below.   Lattes $3 Iced $.50 Homemade syrups $.75 Total with tax $5.14   I will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of The People's Market at Dilworth - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lavender Vanilla Latte  ($5.14 with tax)  $3 Lattes $0.50 iced $0.75 homemade syrups
Photo of The People's Market at Dilworth - Charlotte, NC, United States. More goodies
Photo of The People's Market at Dilworth - Charlotte, NC, United States. All kind of goodies here and there

IQ25wClVmfsVG8VNFyPN_A.text: As the Kinks said many years ago "You gotta give the people what they want!". People's Market most certainly delivers! There's a little something for everyone here! I've been racking my brain trying to remember what fancy restaurant died here...but no matter... The People's Market is a much better fit for the space and a great addition to The Dilworth neighborhood.  The space a has a great flow to it even though it's sectioned for different functions - it just makes sense. We came after dinner for a drink one evening and sat out on their patio. In the immortal words of Tonya P, "Wanna drink retail?". The answer is "Yes, please." Here you can get a bottle of wine, bubbly or beer. If that's not your cup of tea, they have a huge bar with beer on taps or actual tea or coffee or a Matcha Latte - you get the point.  At the back is a deli with Breakfast and Lunch menus that will make your mouth drool. Don't worry though because the deli is open and serving lunch items until 9PM.  Long Live the People's Market!

NddrhDrH56JIFDW3ruOFGg.text: Convenient store on drugs is the perfect way to explain this place. A bloggers event was held here that i was invited to if it wasn't for that once again i would have never known this small hidden gem existed. Parking is right off on the side of peoples market in a good sized parking deck. The fact that the peoples market is surrounded by other eatery's and fun things to do is a plus. I could have just had a field day walking up and down the side walk. As i entered i notice all the people outside on the patio eating,drinking and having a jolly time.   When you walk in it is a very large amount of space. I didn't know where to go first. The set up is like a convenient store but of coarse way bigger. Almost like the perfect one stop shop where you can order sandwich's, they have a bakery, a cool spot towards the back to buy wine and so much more that i didn't get a chance to explore. The bloggers event sponsored us food here so i will have to come back and try out peoples markets goodies. Perfect name for this spot by the way

Z2i6fz5HqYsy8Yu3Og_jUw.text: If you're in the the trendy concept of Urban Markets, you need to stop by The People's Market at Dilworth.  Big space, plenty of seating in and outside. It's a great location to work out of or meet friends for drink.   I love the variety of items offered here--that said, I personally found it to be a bit expensive. However, I think it's worth checking out. We just had cold brews, but there were plenty of draft beers to pick from.   You can order food from the deli and the menu is relatively large for a deli, there is something for everyone.

photos.caption: Photo of The People's Market at Dilworth - Charlotte, NC, United States

KMXNueeTwwhFy96vmIFxOw.text: I've been here twice now to eat and do some work.   Space: plenty of seating; bar, booths and tables. It's open and light, plenty of sun shining through and right in the heart of Dilworth. The bar serves local beers on draft. Again, very large bar area.   Food: I've recently had the People's market salad and added chicken salad on it. Overall, this is a large salad. Veggies were fresh and crispy. Now, I am a little picky about my chicken salad but this was pretty good. Large chicken chunks and light mayo. I've also had the chicken biscuit. I ordered it as it comes, but it the future I would add pimento cheese and maybe some lettuce. I didn't love the mayo on it.  The nitro cold brew is awesome! Served in a pint glass and coming in around $4.75-ish.   There is a large beer and wine selection in the store area. Some chips to choose from to go along with your meal. Overall, a place I will return!

photos.caption: Photo of The People's Market at Dilworth - Charlotte, NC, United States. People&#39;s market salad added chicken salad
Photo of The People's Market at Dilworth - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken biscuit- as it comes. I would order it differently next time.

Kq-1UWVpLi5kLoscU7DaQw.text: Pros: Parking in the parking deck Great breakfast and lunch choices Great beers on tap Great coffee Friendly staff Lots of places to sit  Cons: Can't really think of any besides the baked goods being a bit overpriced.   This place is great to grab a beer or a quick bite to eat. The ambiance is cool. Very clean and trendy. You can also get bottles of wine or beers to go.

photos.caption: Photo of The People's Market at Dilworth - Charlotte, NC, United States

FFYWaQwv8SnZ1OWoIhTukg.text: We really enjoy coming here for Saturday breakfast. You can order breakfast, lunch, sandwiches etc at the deli counter and the. Head over to the coffee bar to grab a latte. They also have lots of beer and wine to choose from. Staff are super friendly, and there is even a patio so you can bring your pup with you! I had the chicken and waffle last time which was so good! The chicken is crispy and it comes with a delicious honey butter. I had the market bagel this time which was very good - lots of avocado and turkey bacon making it semi healthy . I always order a Carmel latte and it's really good here - they use house made Carmel sauce! Go here to grab a bite with some friends or your pooch! You won't be disappointed

photos.caption: Photo of The People's Market at Dilworth - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken and waffle and chicken biscuit in background

K8_J-8ShbxrVWCIFfrK8RA.text: Charlotte folk: imagine a fancier, roomier, more chill Common Market. This place is bright and cheery and packed with everything you could need. There's a deli, fresh coffee/ coffee beverages, beers on tap, wine, plus a variety of grab and go items and novelty items (think hidden flasks, cups, etc). Oh and they keep a bunch of local ice cream shop Two Scoops flavors stocked too for scoops! Had a salad and a coffee here for lunch and was pleased with the quality and size. Try the cilantro vinaigrette! Staff is friendly and prompt. Will definitely be back for a chill after work drink or a quick lunch.

photos.caption: Photo of The People's Market at Dilworth - Charlotte, NC, United States

o5UPsgwua7QDbvgJgtWIXg.text: What a cool concept. I love what they have going on here. It's nice to see more urban markets popping up around Charlotte.   I came here for lunch one day. I wanted to get the That's Balogna Grilled Cheese, but they took it off the menu and hasn't updated it.  They serve breakfast all day, so I ended up getting breakfast country sausage grilled cheese. It was pretty good.   They have a decent amount of seating. Along with the restaurant portion, they have more grocery items, a bar, ice cream, and a bottle section.  There are board games too!   I do wish their menu were a bit more expansive, but all in all, this is a good place to hang out. You can get a little bit of everything all at the same place.

photos.caption: Photo of The People's Market at Dilworth - Charlotte, NC, United States. Country sausage grilled cheese with no biscuit

GcKt-6apdGsNQ_bY_RFKgg.text: How has it taken me this long to write a review for The People's Market...?  I am so sorry.   I come here every weekend. It's a problem. What's an even bigger problem is that in 2 weeks I'm moving from NoDa to Dilworth. People's Market, get ready to see me EVEN MORE often and take EVEN MORE of my money.  What softens the blow is that there are few businesses I'd rather give my hard-earned money to. Everything about this place is perfect. The atmosphere, the food, THE STAFF. Oh my God, I love the staff so much. They're friendly, they're funny, they remember me and treat me like a friend.   Food is solid, cheap, consistent. I love that they offer gluten-free bread. Not sure what else I can say - I've never had a bad meal here.   The bar is awesome, whether you're looking for a mimosa or a cold brew coffee (hint: look for the cold brew coffee - it's the best, creamiest, and most potent I've ever had).   I think everyone has caught on since it seems to be busier every time I go in there. Dilworth is so lucky to have you, People's Market.

fT09zgQv_SDdXu25C66dnA.text: Stoped at the peoples market after church and OMG...this is now one of my favorite spots in charlott. They offer amazing breakfast/lunch items, plenty of vegan, vegetarian and pescatarian options as well as an assortment of coffee, smoothies and cocktails. They have a Triva night on mondays and live jazz on sundays...you won't be disappointed

photos.caption: Photo of The People's Market at Dilworth - Charlotte, NC, United States. Salmon sammie with sprouts and freshly made Sangria

ng2_RDrL1OrkxrHcCEZS6w.text: This is my absolute favorite meeting place, work remotely place, and lose track of time place.   I can go for a morning meeting and grab coffee and a donut, stay through lunch and get a smoothie or a salad, I can wrap up my day by grabbing a bottle of wine and pasta to take home. I. Love. It. Here. Love it!  Oh, and there is a parking garage. That's always a plus.

A72PLd4fCN5cwzWRfWh34g.text: Been waiting to try The People's Market for some time and they did not disappoint! The ambiance is great, the store has an open concept with self serve areas to order/pick up food and drinks. The staff was still very hands on however, making sure you are ok and seem to genuinely enjoy their jobs and helping customers!   I had the carnitas rancheros and I must say it was amazing! The carnitas were cooked perfectly, crispy yet soft and flavorful. It's hard to explain how the perfect carnitas melts in your mouth, but these do just that. The black bean, corn and pepper relish was awesome, over easy egg cooked perfectly and the salsa and avocado were the perfect compliments. (I added shredded cheddar and sour cream to mine).  I also had the hash browns and they were great as well. I'll definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of The People's Market at Dilworth - Charlotte, NC, United States. Carnitas Rancheros

Quj6kLjXp_bokhhhLOdBgw.text: This is on me guys, maybe someone told me? No idea how it took me so long to get here.  Lots to love:  Free parking in the hidden parking deck under the building (or on the street I guess too if you are gambler).  Ice cream, smoothies, hot food, alcohol AND coffee.  Ample indoor and outdoor seating - dog friendly patio.  Great place to come with a friend or two and hang out or get work done for a bit.  Lotttttsss of space - you won't feel cramped here.  The food is solid - its not the brunch dreams are made of but it will do as it seems like a crowd pleasing location.

VT6XOX2e57p2xC9dlLNIFQ.text: Pretty sweet location. Lots of great options for vegans and vegetarians, and of course omnivores. The vegan breakfast burrito is so good. The prices are also a plus, considering an impossible burger somewhere else may cost $15+, this place is a gem. They need to work on their faux bacon considering all the other options out there, but I'm impressed! I hope they keep adding more plant based options for us grass eating folk. ;)  Another thing to note that needs improvement is the plastic waste. Food is served in plastic trays, plastic utensils, plastic everywhere... what's up with that? The planet is in distress and we need real silverware!  Also, all smoothies come prepackaged?? So you can guarantee that they aren't fresh. You also can't switch out anything such as whey, which is disappointing because that makes only the green smoothie non-dairy. If you're allergic to something, too bad.

blDQ-ByT1YbdrQEASOTI_Q.text: First time visiting after having a friend tell me about it several times. The atmosphere is bright yet very relaxed. I ordered the Chicken and Waffle along with a mimosa during brunch hours. The staff was very personable and answered any questions we had immediately. The only minus I have here is that our tickets got prepared out of order, however I was with a group of friends so it was okay.   I would definitely come back here again. I was also excited to see that they had some vegan options in their menu as well.

photos.caption: Photo of The People's Market at Dilworth - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The People's Market at Dilworth - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mexi-mosa. chicken and waffle.

Zo2WvHfWoA08-XrcIYuqzw.text: I dig this place.   Idk why I waited so long to come here, but I'm glad I took time to have a cup of coffee and a move that dough baking company sweet treat here today.  Live music, a chic trendy and clean space with fairly easy access to parking. What more can you ask for.   The deli menu has tons of yummy options for all hours of the day. Vegan burritos and beyond meat burger. The only down fall is the lack of gluten free breads. But it's cool .   The coffee menu is amazing and the beers on tap are equally as good! Beer. Local Coffee. Tea. Coconut water. Wine. Kombucha. Smoothies. Cocktails. They have it all covered.   I'm stoked to make this a regular in my rotation of secret me time spots and places where I meet my squad.  Thanks for having vegan treats -- this is rare and such a treat!

photos.caption: Photo of The People's Market at Dilworth - Charlotte, NC, United States. Move that dough baking co. (Half eaten/ freakin delicious) chakra raspberry bun. Dark roast with oat milk.
Photo of The People's Market at Dilworth - Charlotte, NC, United States. Coffee/bar area
Photo of The People's Market at Dilworth - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pastry lovers paradise

VZAshNT8oC_lmaLjCsgVTg.text: I thought the concept was great. Funny thing is you walk in and it has a diner feel but a market access. The only issue I had is they seem to trying to determine if they want a Diner or a market? Food Was good I had the breakfast burrito and the wife had the Juevos Rancheros and it comes on a hamburger bun (I thought this was a food no no, put it on a bagel or in a wrap like everyone else does, Just makes more sense.) and the wife did not eat the bun. They have ice Cream, Coffee, Food, Groceries and free wifi. If you live in one of the apartments or home in or around the area this would be very convenient to shop and eat at,  but if you live elsewhere in Charlotte, too many other places to eat, with better parking and food. Still a great idea.

photos.caption: Photo of The People's Market at Dilworth - Charlotte, NC, United States. Breakfast burrito was amazing
Photo of The People's Market at Dilworth - Charlotte, NC, United States. Brian&#39;s Juevos Ranchros(?) on a bun? maybe a bagel next time
Photo of The People's Market at Dilworth - Charlotte, NC, United States

tfqDq3wZTM6XBe4umK1KYw.text: Love the vibe of this lil market. I ordered the breakfast burrito and had a latte. The latte was nothing crazy, a classic. However the breakfast burrito was SO GOOD! It's a must have especially since they're generous with the guacamole. If I lived in the area it would be one of my study spots, there's plenty of space and not too loud. I wonder how is it during the day and night. They serve beers and cocktails after hours!

photos.caption: Photo of The People's Market at Dilworth - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The People's Market at Dilworth - Charlotte, NC, United States

RDeJp5-eIZwNizWCIuv0bw.text: Today we ordered this to go. We've ordered here before but for some reason today it just wasn't up to par. I haven't been here in awhile so we decided to try them again. When placing the order it was hard to hear because it was loud in the back. I understand that is hard to control, but it was slightly frustrating .We order two sides of hash browns, the market bagel, and the breakfast burrito with bacon.  Everything was lacking flavor. The hash browns were extremely soft and tasted like they had pounds of Oil on them. The breakfast burrito and the market bagel were both underwhelming. It was almost as if they did not put the basics of salt and pepper on it.  I tried to add more flavor with hot sauce but it was a fail. I was very upset to have wasted my money on something that lacked flavor.  The restaurant itself was cute but we ordered was missing a serious wow factor.

suSg8rEtdOPZT4FzAOraQQ.text: Had a bizarre experience here tonight. I've visited once before but only for coffee and it was great! Came here tonight and got something to eat and my Mom and I both ordered margaritas, one spicy and the other regular (both listed on the cocktail menu). After about 10 minutes they brought us the drinks. They were a red color and I asked what was in them to make them that way? They seemed to be confused when I noted this was a Bloody Mary not a margarita. They had made two bloodys both with orange and margarita garnishes. They eventually said they did they would remake them and we could keep the others if we wanted. We took one but as it was 8pm I didn't really want it not to mention it's not what I ordered. We sat down and they brought us one margarita and started to walk away and I stopped them to ask if the other would come out. They clearly had no intention of making the second and went back to do it and brought it out finally...as a margarita with olives. Very strange as I feel like these are two very basic drinks.

photos.caption: Photo of The People's Market at Dilworth - Charlotte, NC, United States. What I got when I ordered a Spicy Margarita
Photo of The People's Market at Dilworth - Charlotte, NC, United States. Margarita topped off with olives?

hnPxfpsTAc8zZyhyDzjUcw.text: This person has spoken and she is a big fan of the People's Market. From the cheery, yellow decor to the open seating and awesome playlist, once you find a spot you will not want to leave. And leaving is something you won't have to worry about for a few hours.  You can start your morning off with a latte, tea, or any of the other specialty drinks along with something off of their breakfast menu (which they serve all day). After the morning hours have passed, you can transition into lunch with a cold beverage (such as a kombucha or bottled iced tea) from their refrigerated sections and a salad or sandwich. Then, after you've put in all can work-wise, you can cap off of your day with a margarita shaken up right at the bar. That's right, the same area where you picked up your morning latte is also where you can be served a margarita on the rocks.  Talk about a FULL-SERVICE BAR, FOLKS.  My only recommendation? Try everything.

photos.caption: Photo of The People's Market at Dilworth - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The People's Market at Dilworth - Charlotte, NC, United States

izLBmx5qZ364y3yubpF6uw.text: My favorite place to meet clients or to have group meetingsZ A great selection of drinks, every food item I've ordered has been good and the customer service is A1

wm9jJpeiBtxgbbaE05hEEA.text: Love this place for breakfast! We just recently found it and have now made it our weekend thing! Tons of seating, not usually very packed tho. Great bar & drink selection (fair pricing) & in the back they have a grill which makes the BEST food! Anything you might want- Avocado toast, breakfast burritos, waffles, French toast, pancakes, hash browns! Good coffee/espresso bar. Clean inside. Patio. They even have a full beer & wine selection like a market! Ugh. Can't say enough!

photos.caption: Photo of The People's Market at Dilworth - Charlotte, NC, United States

M9gXwCvqti56GGSYQOtEiw.text: Yepper.  Dilworth you have a winner here.  Trendy, modern and located across from Starbucks, The People's Market has claimed this corner as their own.  And business seems to be growing.  I have visited about a dozen times for coffee and breakfast.  Admittedly, it's a quirky set up to order.  But, if you want food, start at that counter and place your coffee order, too.  It'll be ready in a jiffy at the coffee bar.  Just mosey over.  Easy.  Their chicken biscuit with gravy is ridiculous--large, savory, fresh and hot, it's a meal for two.  Serious gut buster.   Wanna a bagel sammie instead?  Order the Market Bagel with turkey bacon, egg, cheese, and avocado.  It runs the boards on flavor.  Buy it.  Can they hold their own against an onslaught of similar pop ups?  Lincoln's Haberdashery, Rhino, Earl's, Laurel, and Common Market are serious competitors.  For now People's seems to be one, too.    I say "Give 'em a whirl" to see what all the brouhaha is about.

photos.caption: Photo of The People's Market at Dilworth - Charlotte, NC, United States. Market Bagel, delicious.
Photo of The People's Market at Dilworth - Charlotte, NC, United States. Park kitty corner at Brixx for easy in/out in the morning.
Photo of The People's Market at Dilworth - Charlotte, NC, United States. I grow this in my garden.  Glad more places are offering an honest substitute for sweeteners.

-uKj6hcJw0sEV7NFYLw8nw.text: Pretty solid place for breakfast. I've had the Breakfast platter twice and the breakfast burrito once. Both were excellent. Also I've gotten lattes when I've visited and they were good too. They have a nice design at the top which makes it feel fancier than it really is. The space is big and even during busier hours I've always been able to find a place to sit.

photos.caption: Photo of The People's Market at Dilworth - Charlotte, NC, United States. Latte
Photo of The People's Market at Dilworth - Charlotte, NC, United States. Latte
Photo of The People's Market at Dilworth - Charlotte, NC, United States. Breakfast burrito

rG0q_X0D6BRVOxvESzjqjw.text: Give me all the Charcoal Lattes and Move That Dough Doughnuts. The perfect place to just hang out, enjoy the good selection of music and the friendly staff.

Zbv4OHjzEFJ7iLjKYGw9yA.text: Finally made it over to People's Market and Dilworth for a breakfast meeting and was glad we chose this place. There's parking nearby which is great and it was easy to find. The place is very spacious with all the knick knacks of a market, along with a bar and a deli. The decor was chic and the vibe fit the neighborhood well.  For breakfast I went with the chicken biscuit. This is no ordinary chicken biscuit! It is huge with 2 chicken breast and eggs topped with gravy. It was delish and filling! I also had a mimosa which they made fresh so of course it was great. They also had a dj playing some old school tunes which added to the vibe. I'm a fan of People's Market.

Ywzz-0WM6nJ-YL7txoqr_w.text: This place never disappoints. I'm pretty much a regular here! The vibe is very homie and inviting. The staff is very friendly and accommodating. This place is a work space, restaurant, bar, coffee shop, and convenience store all rolled into one place.   They offer local products, like Green Brothers Juice, which I enjoy.  They have fresh baked goods from local companies also. The food that they serve is amazing. I've had almost everything from the Chicken and Waffles to the Vegan burger.  Everything they cook has been great! TIP: the chicken here is cooked to perfection. Let's not forget the drinks that they serve. They are know for their RUMmosa made with freshly squeezed juice. You just can't get any better then that.   I would recommend this place is you need a workspace, to have a small meeting, or just come to eat. Don't just take my word for it try it out!!

dgq-bpR1sFgp60Zr3xPMvQ.text: Honestly, this is one of my favorite places in Charlotte to go when I'm looking for somewhere to work remotely. The staff is super friendly, they have outdoor seating and  a variety of indoor seating options, food and plenty of random  things to purchase. I fell in love with the whole vibe after being about to buy a bottle of wine and have a glass (or two) while I worked. And I don't think they charge anything extra if you do. Also, I usually go and get a dessert from the deli.   This was the first time I purchased food or ordered a drink. I ordered a rumosa and chicken and waffle. The chicken and waffle was good but the sauce that comes with it was DELICIOUS!   I wish they had more indoor seating because it can get busy but my only real issue with coming here is parking. Depending on the time of day, it can be hard to find.   Would I go back? Absolutely, I've probably been back 2 or 3 times since this visit!

photos.caption: Photo of The People's Market at Dilworth - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken and waffle
Photo of The People's Market at Dilworth - Charlotte, NC, United States. Rumosa
Photo of The People's Market at Dilworth - Charlotte, NC, United States. Reading with a side of rum-mosa...why not?

XIeXhlOJdShpImv2iQUfIA.text: Grab your fork and knife for this monster because this isn't your ordinary breakfast sandwich. Southern fried chicken w/ scrambled eggs and sausage gravy on a biscuit. I was in the mood for biscuits and gravy and when I came across this, it amplified my craving. The outer crumbles from the fried chicken had a nice salty crunch which was perfect between bites of the warm chicken meat, egg and gravy. Loved the fluffy warm biscuit. Huge fan of this dish. Got a blueberry cream muffin on the side. Would have liked some more gravy action, definitely recommend requesting extra.

photos.caption: Photo of The People's Market at Dilworth - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken Biscuit.

Vb4pS8WdHFc570Nye1j7XQ.text: Love coming here!!! Friendly staff. Veggie friendly menu. Great line of local speciality items. Relaxed environment!!!

photos.caption: Photo of The People's Market at Dilworth - Charlotte, NC, United States. Margarita

Hw8VouWi4ibGRVCp7eZT-w.text: Good food, great people.  I've been here for breakfast, lunch, dinner, and drinks and have never left unhappy.  Considering how congested many local establishments have become, it is great to have a place that gives you room to breath and have a conversation.    More importantly, the entire staff from ownership down has been a genuine pleasure to deal with.  They've earned our business!

ixjQ0UqYJmHYiotow_BUug.text: Great burger. Breakfast Burgers are one of the best. Like their beers also. Great atmosphere overall.

f2osAzBzIMrYQxkH4fw6Yw.text: Very cool place, great location, free wifi,everything is fresh and they have outlets all over to plug in your laptop or charge your phone

XTxYFFj5KNCuojk5jl_cTA.text: I'm not sure what this place is trying to be. What they do need is training in customer service. Walk in to order, and I'm waiting a 2-3 good minutes, finally someone that was sitting at the bar eating gets up and asks me what I need. Always good to see staff members just chilling and eating. I placed my order quickly, making sure not to interrupt the order taker's breakfast. When it comes up it's missing its side. I inquire and now a different team member informs me that my side is in the self service cooler, and I could help myself. This place is to big and confusing to be successful. I think they are trying to be an ultra upscale common market, well they aren't even close. Every restaurant in the spot has failed, and this one will be no different.

CgfMvNAPlluD94Hng4cG7A.text: I'm disappointed in this place because the hype was so big leading up to its' opening. We walked in for a coffee and breakfast and did not get warm and fuzzy feelings from the staff. The place feels cold and unwelcoming; the staff were taking to each other and I felt as though I was interrupting. My latte was cold and sweet and there was nothing personable about my interactions with the barista. Again; felt like I was interfering on his morning. After buying a $6 juice and $17 almond butter (seriously!??) we checked out the breakfast options. Deli sandwich was terrible quality; greasy, cold, sloppy. Would return to buy wine and cheese but would like to see some improvement in the customer service aspect. Concept is great and has some real potential!

EocPtkQdNZ42-h6SnUzcIA.text: This is such a great place!  Plenty to choose from - urban provisions, breakfast, lunch, craft beer & cider selections(both bottles, cans, and on tap), as well as wine, coffee, the "whole 9 yards"!  The staff is friendly and knowledgeable, and if you see Sarah behind the bar, you will see a constant smile, upbeat, and helpful person!

vo7EZfQ50lQINyI_nCowcA.text: Not impressed!! Our sandwich lacked basic seasoning. Our coffee was very watery... The place lacked cohesion with regards to ordering... Had to order breakfast in one area and coffee in another. The only thing positive I can say is decent decor and plenty of seating. Won't be going back.

LtBEGIqv7V-a90bpyzsznw.text: Was at the People's Market for a Blogger event! This place is so nice, very tasty food, and the cofee in a cone's are to die for!!

BBkAjQwchwQHfE1_6e1ZYw.text: I'm so glad this place opened. The coffee and food are great, as well as the atmosphere.

c3wS1wIh6x3WkPMt8lfMGw.text: I've read the positive reviews and tried to see what they were seeing but I just cannot. I was so excited about this place. Totally was expecting a Dilworth-spin on Earl's Grocery. But what we got is an IKEA market. It's stark and not welcoming and the aluminum barstools are so uncomfortable (so much for hanging out with friends). Everyone in the neighborhood with a work from home gig, and every PTA mom who has breakfast and/or lunch committee meetings (I identify with both categories) was anxiously awaiting somewhere besides Mayobird to eat while meeting. The food quantity and price point doesn't make up for the lack of ambiance or personality. The space is so huge and has so much potential. Right now it's a drafty cement slab with tons and tons of unused space and no character. I'm rooting for it to adjust to the hood, but Dilworth deserves more than what The People's Market is currently offering.

-LooxaO6P_Nntxe0rIWJ0g.text: I've been here five times now. I always enjoy the food. It's consistent and tastes great. It's always clean as well. I recommend it to everyone that's looking for a good breakfast spot.

W6vJ1j4qPP92ChWXzGQYkg.text: Has a ton of potential but definitely some kinks to work out in the kitchen. Took 25 minutes for my husband and I to get egg and bagel sandwiches and there were only 4 orders for the kitchen at the time. My order was completely wrong but they fixed it - non apologetic staff for the noticeably long wait and food issue though. Just have to find their groove and once they do could be a great place! Good atmosphere, wine and beer selection and location.

BlHSqFwTY8NL3XJtgbCOrw.text: BLT was a 9/10, but the service needs some work. Lot of people working there but no one is really paying attention to what's going on.  The staff just takes the chill vibe too far, to the point where chilling out is number one priority versus helping customers. I think once that part gets worked out, this place will do fine.

qdGM2NBGAKHJa-OSdivd5Q.text: Walked In here on a Saturday night and was greeted by Kim immediately.  Kimmy was helping me with their on tap beers and  TJ was helping us choice wine. The kitchen made us a cheese plate (not on menu) that was to die for. Wonderful place. Recommend to everyone. Oh sandwiches, coffee etc ... will definitely come back the next time I'm in Charlotte

f2PQ_5etyLip2-vw8G9mCA.text: Great neighborhood spot. Coffee is top notch, atmosphere is chill. I've had the deli food once and the club sandwich is top notch and a healthy size. I can bring my whole family here and enjoy!

nO50zbZ0MFYCHAQ43RLhLg.text: Beautiful spot with good coffee and great sandwiches.  Lots of upside to this spot. Staff was friendly.  Chix Salad Sand was delicious.

9HsH_D6lCQZ8pUjJnKViKw.text: I anxiously awaited the opening of People's Market.  The area definitely needs a Common Market/Rhino Deli type establishment.  Unfortunately, the final product doesn't hit the mark.  I'm left wondering if they rushed to open before they had the store fully stocked.  You only get once chance to make a first impression.  I walked in asking myself, "are they really open?  where is everything?"  It's heavy on beer and wine but not much else.  How about lots of healthy snack options and non-alcoholic beverages like various types of kombucha? The lunch menu is ok but it would be nice to have non-processed protein options like chicken breast, natural unprocessed turkey breast, salmon, etc.  I'm in no rush to return unless I hear that they've filled the store out with more choices.  I'm not suggesting you need to clone Rhino or Common Market but perhaps walk through and get some ideas, otherwise People's Market is just too limited.

WIeOobiaSzRqsiDxefO9Fw.text: This place seems like it wants to be a beer bar, bottle shop, coffee shop, convenience store, and a deli. While I fully support the enthusiasm, it's hard to execute all those components well and keep everything cohesive. Ordered a sandwich, coffee, and bottle of water from three different parts of the place. That order would have been frustrating if this place was busy at all.  My sandwich order got lost (it happens from time to time NBD) but the sandwich, 10$ club, didn't make it worth the wait or the price. Coffee wasn't anything I'd go out of my way for either. There was almost nothing on the shelves to purchase which made the convenience store part seem pretty much useless. Seating was great though.  I'll probably give this place another shot but I'll have to have a game plan first. I think I'll do a hitch route for a coffee then run a post for a breakfast sandwich in the back. Celebrate with a beer if all goes well.

qI2jhpsMFMF2Duv8dA9L6w.text: I love getting breakfast here when I get a chance. It seems like it's the only place that has a good breakfast burrito. They're always friendly and able to modify my order as requested, and it's usually pretty fast.   Highly recommend the breakfast burrito as mentioned. Many of the breakfast places around have started using red potatoes in their breakfast burritos for god knows what reason. People's Market uses hashbrowns and it's amazing. Would recommend adding the sriracha mayo to your order.

6C4PhHCoF1SDsQq-mbVn_g.text: Great aesthetic, and lovely wine selection! The food is great, a little pricey for a biscuit BUT breakfast is served all day which is a major plus for me. They also have gluten free bread! Not bad considering today was day 1 of their business. We will be returning to try some of be beer on tap and more of the food selections.

photos.caption: Photo of The People's Market at Dilworth - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The People's Market at Dilworth - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The People's Market at Dilworth - Charlotte, NC, United States

Z22qe4bvffC1zTeT9D5jeQ.text: The coffee/crew keep me coming back. Always stoked to see Amber & Will behind bar, they never disappoint. There on a weekend? Walk right on past any pouched pickles and enjoy some top shelf donuts from Move That Dough Baking Co.

photos.caption: Photo of The People's Market at Dilworth - Charlotte, NC, United States

lseGSgIM9zj1SVNdpHJtaQ.text: Cute spot! I really liked my sandwich! Really chill. Great place to hang with friends.

photos.caption: Photo of The People's Market at Dilworth - Charlotte, NC, United States

EqnN0aQ5Av7wzELpLhM9-A.text: The People's Market is akin to Charlotte success stories such as Common Market and Rhino Market, but it definitely has it's own (Dilworth) vibe going. All of the employees are friendly and helpful. The food does take a while but they just opened yesterday. We ordered two sandwiches and there were two individual people in front of us but it took about 15-20 minutes to get our order. That being said, the club and the BLT were top notch. They have a great wine and beer selection. I did not try the coffee but will be coming back for one soon. Looking forward to more visits here in the near future!

AaKlRk5nou3Pr2WrlKcffQ.text: The concept is good. I don't get a warm fuzzy feeling from the staff or the market. Beer selection is okay. Not a wide variety on tap. The wine by the glass is very limited.  Not sure I will return.

photos.caption: Photo of The People's Market at Dilworth - Charlotte, NC, United States. Wide open concept. Feels a bit cold

1iOUdOHC8WvXT_AMrzGGWw.text: Walked in this morning around 10:30, sat at the bar to an inattentive bartender and waited a few minutes before he walked away. Well, I walked away also, right across what street to Starbucks. It will take a lot of encouraging to get me to return to The Peoples Market.

xK_cuB3rk_yD2KApmbGFOg.text: Everything here is great. It's a perfect casual breakfast or lunch spot. I got the lavender vanilla iced latte and a breakfast sandwich with modifications. Delicious!

FiMgxHZNG5IXxrhB-MtzYQ.text: A group of us that are all 25-26 came and the women denied 3/6 of our ID's. The 6 of us are visiting from out of town and of course don't have local id's. Will never recommend this place.

Qo0wK3G83sZ-nWQUW2tBYg.text: AHHMAZIN' breakfast sandwiches, great beer selection, and the coffee ain't bad either. The place is HUGE and feels like just a comfy neighborhood hangout. Plenty of spots to drop down with a group, or grab a spot at the bar or counter seating. Also some comfy looking couches on one side.

a6kOVjzYqkhR1jthXzpFhA.text: Don't get the chicken sandwich here. Couldn't even finish it. I've had hospital food that is better.

HKrYsG-izGgJir5k18F37g.text: Fantastic food, good prices, and more importantly awesomely cheerful staff. This was our first visit and will not be our last. Everyone was so helpful considering we had no idea what to do and they took the quick minute to make us feel at home. For anyone else who hasn't been here, pick a station to start at and give them a card.  This will open a tab for you across all stations so you can go to hot food for example, order food open a tab, then go over to drinks/bar order there while you are waiting for your food and either keep open or close out your tab with everything totaled one time. Great place great vibe, super people. Thanks for a great first impression.

cc_F_tJe4hvshLO5GeCKLQ.text: I love this place. The vegan burrito is spicy and delicious. My husband got huevous rancheros and loved it. The sweet potato fries were crispy and light. We also got vegan cinnamon rolls that were amazing. To top it off, they brought our food to our table when they didn't have to.

LMPifaUB7uLHTqX7mGohMA.text: Very nice customer service. Their selection is phenomenal. They have beautiful crafted sandwiches and burgers and they can be substituted with the vegan impossible burger. The market makes fresh milkshakes at the bar

VMzc-G10eBp_J75Sr-RG4w.text: Overall this place is good with potential to be great. I've been here many times because of convenience and the quality of food is really good. I haven't had a bad sandwich yet and I've had about 6 different options (breakfast and lunch). The atmosphere is very inviting and is great for everyone. However, the large open areas and organization of the market  is confusing. They do not serve iced coffee unless you want to pay $5+ for a nitro cold brew or pay for a cup of ice. Overall, I enjoy coming to this place often but there is definite room for improvement.

QN1nstNOqP1Npx9jHrNeQQ.text: Obsessed! Great priced wine, no corkage fee, yummy food (had the vegan burger). Definitely will be back soon!

-pUU-BGoWAlL1Vculp5rEw.text: Place is just what East Blvd needed. Have been to grab coffee and get work done, just eat lunch or have a beer with friends and play board games. Definitely still new, and once they find their groove will take off. Look forward to going back soon.

tInovHUp1DARUQwf2_V9jQ.text: I usually don't like hipster-ish places like his but I always have a great time.  Decent beer good food and nice people. No my go to but always a great spot.

vsMsqO9VA2WkZsNkmr33YQ.text: My visit here was extremely underwhelming. I was waiting for the chance to come here, now that I have, I may not come again. The food selection was tiny and just not worth the money I payed for it.
